p: Factors associated with an increased risk of travel-related VTE included obesity, use of estrogen containing contraceptives, extremes of height, and prothrombotic hematological conditions [ 109]. Additionally chronic inflammation associated with a wide variety of disorders such as inflammatory bowel disease and rheumatoid arthritis has been suggested as a contributing factor in the development of VTE. Finally, some immunosuppression strategies may increase VTE risk (e.g., JAK inhibition). The immunosuppressed traveler on treatment for an inflammatory disorder should therefore be encouraged to follow the above advice on remaining mobile during travel [ 111].
